trends: There have been 30 other sightings in Boulder
There were no other sightings in Boulder on or around April 28th 2011
Summary: Orange light twinkling due South. maybe45 degrees from the horizon. two to three times brighter than the brightest star. Phased in and out several times before it disappeared entirely.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was taking the dog out for the last time for the night. We were on the side of my apartment building. I was only outside for maybe five or ten minutes. I noticed it at first because it was very bright in the sky even though some front porn lights were in my eyes. At first, I thought it was a planet, but it was too bright. It stayed in the same position the whole time I observed it. First, the light was steady, then it started to twinkled like a star, then it got brighter. It was yellow-orange in color. Then it seemed to "phase" in and out, not like a twinkle, more the whole image came and went. Then it got bright for the last time and disappeared. The whole thing lasted three minutes at the most. I kept my gaze in that direction the whole time. I did not, however, see it appear to begin with, so I don't know how long it was there before I got there. How did I feel? I was in awe. And a bit shocked. I don't know of anything that could do that. Certainly wasn't an airplane or a satellite, couldn't be a star or a planet, so what could it be?
